result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Guenther Marek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Court Costs are paid in full - Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.  The remaining portion of the cash bond has been refunded to the Poster.  Costs imposed include the psychological interview conducted by Dr. Christina Engen in the amount of $1155.00.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with all treatment and medication regimens that are prescribed by Dr. Patel or any other medical professional Defendant is working with.  Complete the treatment regimen through the current CCS Program (Comprehensive Community Services) as part of Waushara Co DHS.  Treatment to continue until it is determined by staff to approve discharge.   Defendant is expected to provide random blood screens and random urine screens.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber Privileges granted.  No Good Time Credit.  The Court would expect that the Defendant will be provided the opportunity to continue with his current treatment regimen while incarcerated, including any current medications.  Any prescribed medications to continue pursuant to jail rules and as allowed.

Case Called @ 3:03 PM: Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Andrea Behnke CCS/CCP Program, sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Carver.  Cross Exam by DA.  Re Direct by Atty Carver.  Re Cross by DA.  Exam by Court.  Re Cross by DA.  Victim has joined hearing, makes statement to the Court.  Terra Francke Crisis sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Carver.  Cross Exam by DA.  Re Direct by Atty Carver.  Ngin Phang Marek (fiance) makes a statement to the Court.  Def's Father makes statement to the Court.  Argument by DA - argues for probationary sentence.  Argument by Atty Carver - argues for alternative that does not include further jail time.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Ct 2:  S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Ct Nos 4 & 6:  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Concurrent probation terms.  Conditions of supervision:  Complete a AODA and any follow thru,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Comply with all treatment and medications regimens that are prescribed by Dr. Patel or any other medical profession Def is working with; Complete the treatment regimen thru the CCS program currently working with - treatment to continue until they determine it is appropriate to discharge Def; provide random blood screens and random urine screens;  As to Ct 2 only - 29 days WCJ - no credit for time served to be applied - in the even of any revocation credit will be applied at that time, Court does not want Def's Badger Care placed in jeopardy.  Report 10/1/2015 at 8:00 pm.  Expectation that Def will be provided the opportunity to include treatment regimen while incarcerated including current meds.  No position taken on medications which might be narcotics while incarcerated.  Prescriptions to continue pursuant to jail rules and as allowed.  Court Costs - bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.  By the end of the day on Monday must report to DOC for intake.  Competency exam fee of $1155 ordered.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 08-07-2015 03:00 pm

Case called @ 1:20 p.m. Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached and agreement and the defendant is willing to enter a plea but is requesting another date for plea/sentencing.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 2, 4 & 6 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1, 3 & 5 - DRI. The court reminds the defendant that bond remains in effect and a violation of the bond could result in a revocation of the offer.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Case called @ 10:33 a.m. Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson - DE has entered a NGI plea - Dr. report has been filed. Atty Carver - there are no other reports to contradict the report that has been filed. Atty Carver's position would be to withdraw the NGI plea but is unsure as to her client's wishes regarding that matter. The court questions the DE as to his position - DE does not wish to withdraw the NGI plea. The court declines to appoint another person to conduct another evaluation. After further discussion with the defendant he wishes to withdraw the NGI plea and wishes to proceed with a NG plea only. Atty Carver requesting a trial date - negotiations will continue with the state but feels it's best to get it on the trial calendar.  Jury trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Status conference at 06-09-2015 10:15 am

14CF115 & 14CM294 Cases called @ 1:47 p.m.Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Bifurcated plea entered NG/NGI as to all counts. The court orders a 971.16 evaluation be completed. The court orders the previous competency evaluation be made available to the evaluating physician on this matter. Atty Carver filed a Motion for Joinder of the complaints. No objection by ADA Anderson. The court grants the Motion for Joinder filed by Atty Carver. The court permits a change of plea in 14CM494 from NG to a bifurcated NG/NGI plea.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case called @ 3:35 p.m. Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court has previously review the doctor's report. ADA Anderson stipulates to the admission of the report that finds the defendant competent to priceed. Atty Carver also stipulates to the admission of the report. The court receives the report filed by the doctor for evidentiary purposes. The court finds that the defendant has regained competency and that the defendant agrees that he is competent to proceed in this matter. The court orders that the bond previously imposed be reinstated.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 09:10 am.

10:17 am cases called-14CF115 & 14CM294. Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver, both by phone.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over competency report provided to Court. Court questions Attorney Carver regarding status. Statement by Attorney Carver. Further statement by Court regarding report and competency hearing. Further statement by Attorney Carver. Court states an order for Treatment to Competence was completed back in September which is the controlling order. Court states based on report filed by the Department. Court directs the Department to determine if Mr. Marek needs to remain inpatient. The court did not order the inpatient determination be done, the department determines, and the department is the arbitor of whether the defendant remain inpatient and the court will not order the release until determination of competency during the comptency hearing.

4:02 pm cases called. 14CF115 & 14CM294. Defendant Brandon Guenther Marek in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Competency hearing held. Statement by DA Blader regarding request by doctor and agreement from Attorney and Defendant. Statement by Attorney Carver-stipulation regarding doctors records. Further statement by Attorney Carver regarding proceeding today. Attorney Carver makes statement regarding report submitted. Agreement by both parties that the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time. Court finds that by perponderance of the evidence the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time but is likely to restore to competency. Court orders the defendant to the custody to the Department. Court does not find appropriate to determine inpatient/outpatient. Court authorizes release of the file materials in other matter, under the direction it may not be duplicated. Court amends bond IN 14CF115.
